column4: Mmh guys i got some kind of issue with wifi... i think it's driver related, but i'm not really sure :(
i can't get to connect to my school's wi-fi under ubuntu
it uses hidden SSID and multiple broadcasting access points
it works fine on Win7 though
and i heard people saying they had no problem with Ubuntu
but it just won't work on my comp
excuse me <_<
soo well let me' sum it up
I can't get to connect to my school's Wi-FI network (hidden SSID, multiple access points, and in-browser auth) using Ubuntu. I got no issue on Win7 though. Do you think it's driver related ?
I doubt it I think its the type of encryption they use....like tokens or EAP mode maybe
like software tokens with Radius or anything like that
well
they don't use any kind of encryption LWSDesigns
just hidden SSID
hmm thats an issue I can't solve I have the same issue
aw :/
okay
I had a program installed trying to think of name green icon logo on ubuntu 6.06 to solve it
:o
Rutilt Manager
mmmh
back then it wasn't an ideal fix I will look into a bit here if you will online for awhile
this hasn't been updated for 2y, isn't the ubuntu integrated wirless manager better?
